meanings.definition: (adjective) Slender or more slender in an attractive or graceful way.
meanings.sent1: The ballerina looked svelter than the other dancers on stage.
meanings.sent2: She aimed to become svelter by eating healthier and exercising regularly.
meanings.sent3: The elegant swan appeared even svelter when it wore a tiny crown.
meanings.sent4: Her silhouette against the sunset was as svelter as a delicate reed.
meanings.sent5: The svelter figure of the model left a lasting impression on the audience.

meanings.definition: (verb) To make or become more slender or graceful.
meanings.sent1: The tailor sveltered the dress to fit the client's figure perfectly.
meanings.sent2: She svelters her body through yoga and pilates.
meanings.sent3: The magician sveltered the scarf into a rabbit, surprising the audience.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to svelter the ancient ruins into delicate sculptures.
meanings.sent5: The artist sveltered the brush strokes to create a masterpiece.
